oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 05 e
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 05 e. Newspaper clipping: "Ask Passage Of Ordinance To Abate It.'
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Smoke; Pollution;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: ASK PASSAGE OF ORDINANCE TO ABATE IT All Women of City Invited To Go To Women's Building Wednesday. The city commission Tuesday promised a committee from Ossoli Circle to "consider" the passage of an ordinance to eliminate the smoke nuisance. Mrs. L. Crozier French, chairman of the Ossoli committee, urged the passage of the ordinance and submitted to the commission a copy of the Louisville smoke prevention ordinance. Commissioner Adams said he would be willing to vote for such an ordinance if convinced it would really prove effective. He suggested that the commission communicate with other cities to learn the methods adopted to prevent smoke and whether or not successful. Mayor Neal said this would be done. He said he was not familiar with the use of smoke consumers. Commissioner Wayland said much of the smoke came from railroad engines. "I doubt if we could compel them to put on smoke consumers," said Mayor Neal. Mrs. French invited all women of the city to attend a meeting of the Constitutional League at the Woman's-bldg Wednesday at 3 p. m., to discuss smoke prevention.
